summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York for the date August 10, 2019. The sheets are for different tiers (M, J, K, G, H) and detail the required observation schedule for inmates in locked-down status, to be reviewed by lieutenants and a captain. The date is significant as it is the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.

events.title: Inmate Observation Checks at MCC New York
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks were documented for inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York, following protocol for inmates in continuous locked-down status.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison check sheets dated August 10, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein died.
It outlines the strict observation protocol for inmates in the Special Housing Unit, requiring checks at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are for multiple tiers (M, J, K, G, H) within the unit, indicating a standard procedure was in place.
The forms were to be reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, documenting oversight.
The existence of these check sheets is directly relevant to investigations into the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death.
